description: This sauce is very simple, but it has a secret to achieve excellence: **time**. Cook over very low heat, a long time.
items: Start peeling and chopping the garlic.
Fry them with a splash of oil in a frying pan.
When they start to reach color, add the well-chopped onion (small brunoise). Leave it on very low heat to confit and add a pinch of salt.
When the onion is well cooked, add the chopped tomato with its juice and leave it over a low heat to confit.
When all the juices from the tomatoes has almost been consumed, it is time to add the chopped basil.
Boil the potatoes with the skin, starting from the cold water. Cook them over medium heat until you can stick a knife without resistance (approximately 45-60 minutes).
While still hot, peel them and put in a bowl to make the dough.
Maash the potatos and add the yolks and flour. Then add salt, pepper and nutmeg. Mix well with your hands until the dough does not stick to your fingers.
To achive the gnocchi shape, take portions of dough and make a cilinder of 1 cm in diameter. Then cut it into 1 cm segments.
_For the most daring: _ to get gnocchi well soaked in the sauce, they are striated. This is achieved by sliding our portions on a sushi mat or on a fork with the tips down.
Cooking the gnocchi is very simple: bring to a boil a pot with water and a pinch of salt. Then, add the gnocchi and wait for them to float, which indicates that they are ready.

description: It is time to combine both preparations. For this, you need a little of the cooking water of the gnocchi, the already cooked gnocchi and the tomato sauce. Fry these elements for a few minutes over medium heat and you will have it ready to eat.
